postData.title: Projects
postData.contentHtml:
Here is a list of projects that I created or contributed to. All of them are open-source, so you can also check how I write code ðŸ˜…. Some of them need improvements, so if you are willing to contribute, contact me.

Still alive

  1. mockingcase: node package that converts a string to mOcKiNgCaSe It may be a not very useful package, but while working on it I learned a lot, and still consider it as amazing piece of software. More about it here.

  2. CoFeed-19: Client-only Feed Reader, Free, No tracking, Minimalist. I created a free minimalistic Client-only Feed Reader to track my favorite blogs.

  3. redux-requests: Redux addon to simplify handling of AJAX requests. I added the promise driver, set up the documentation site with docusaurus, and participated in discussions about library design.

  4. roataway.md: Open-source app, that displays real-time positions of public transport. I added features like vehicle off-route updates, render vehicles as "off", marker drift on zoom.

  5. tt: Command-line time tracker written in shell script Why and How I built this tool.

  6. jump2header: add "jump to" links for markdown headers Used in several popular open-source projects like exceljs, react-native-webview and others.

  7. @strdr4605/eslint-plugin-react-props-destructuring: A very opinionated rule for ReactJS props destructuring. See discussion here.

  8. WHO AM I: At BEST Hackathon 2021 my team and I created an Augmented Reality game. Play it with your friends.

  9. Spacebook: At NASA Hackathon 2019 my team and I created a Progressive Web App which shows Astronomy Picture of the Day in an infinite scroll feed. A (not perfect) app that works by these days.

  10. Extinction Map: At FAF Hackathon 2020, my team and I created a web app that shows a map with timeline of animals that become extinct.

  11. fucking-nothing: a trolling projects that looks like nothing but it's actually not.

  12. issue-branch-action: Github action that comment on an issue when a related branch is created.

  13. Fracfik: At my first Hackathon we created a game that help kids to learn fraction operations.

Somehow dead

  1. @goparrot/react-native-geometry-utils: Google maps geometry utils for react-native I worked with React Native Modules and wrote some Kotlin and Swift. There are non-async replacements for this library, but it's still used.

Archived because we found same functionality without native bridge.

  1. 999 Plus: Extension for sorting 999.md items.

Sorting was added to the site, but the extension is still useful to remove booster posts.

  1. @strdr4605/react-native-rename: A fork of react-native-rename@2.4.1 with several improvements. Archived now.

Archived because original library finally added the missing features.
